edge.helper

Class EdgeLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • edge.helper.EdgeLogger

  • public class EdgeLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    The EdgeLogger provides a neat interface to collect log data. Logs are useful in case when the application suddenly hangs up or struggles with situations we have not prepared for (a hdd crash for example). The logger receives a string containing the actual file to log in the constructor. check the EdgeLogger JavaDoc for further examples.

    • Method Detail

      • log

        private void log(java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message to the logFile. This method is used as an alias when no controller is specified. It defaults controller to MainApplication SuppressedWarning because we haven't had the chance to use this method yet.
        Parameters:
        message - the actual message which should be logged to the file.

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.Class<?> controller,
                java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message to the logFile. The logString is built using the following schema: [current time][current controller][current package][current logcycle]: message
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller class which fired the log method (defaults to MainApplication)
        message - the actual message which should be logged to the file.

      • getLogFile

        public java.io.File getLogFile()

      • setLogFile

        public void setLogFile(java.io.File logFile)
